snippet: Data from the largest analysis to date of amyloid plaques showed they can appear 20 or 30 years before dementia symptoms.
abstract: Two linked studies published in JAMA confirm that presence of amyloid plaques and protein that creates them in the brain are indicators of who will develop Alzheimer's and can lead to diagnosis of disease.
lead_paragraph: Data from the largest analysis to date of amyloid plaques showed they can appear 20 or 30 years before dementia symptoms.

headline.main: Studies Confirm Brain Plaque Can Help Predict Alzheimer’s
headline.print_headline: Studies Confirm Brain Plaque Can Help Predict Alzheimer’s

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
